Current RR: 10.45

 • Required RR: 10.87

 • Last 5 ov (RR): 50/3 (10.00)

Win Probability:AUS 23.88% • WI 76.12%

Report

The visitors have brought back Sean Abbott in place of spinner Matt Kuhnemann

Australia won the toss and decided to bowl against West Indies

Australia have opted to chase on what Mitchell Marsh termed the smallest ground he had seen for international cricket in St Kitts as the visitors look to take an unassailable 3-0 lead in the T20I series.

They have made one change with allrounder Sean Abbott replacing left-arm spinner Matt Kuhnemann while Marsh expected a high-scoring contest.

  • Australia go 2-0 up as Inglis and Green sour Russell's farewell

  • 'He's playing beautifully' - Is Green Australia's new T20 middle-order fulcrum?

West Indies have two changes, one enforced with the retirement of Andre Russell while Alzarri Joseph is having a rest. Jediah Blades, a 23-year-old pace bowler, makes his T20I debut and allrounder Romario Shepherd comes back into the XI.

Australia were convincing winners of both games at Sabina Park with their power-packed batting line-up especially impressive. Glenn Maxwell was carded to open again alongside Marsh.

These matches are the first men's T20Is in St Kitts since 2022. In the history of the Caribbean Premier League (CPL) the ground has the highest batting strike-rate of all venues.

West Indies 1 Brandon King, 2 Shai Hope (capt & wk), 3 Roston Chase, 4 Shimron Hetmyer, 5 Rovman Powell, 6 Sherfane Rutherford, 7 Jason Holder, 8 Gudakesh Motie, 9 Akeal Hosein, 10 Romario Shepherd, 11 Jediah Blades

Australia 1 Mitchell Marsh (capt), 2 Glenn Maxwell, 3 Josh Inglis (wk), 4 Cameron Green, 5 Tim David, 6 Mitchell Owen, 7 Cooper Connolly, 8 Ben Dwarshius, 9 Sean Abbott, 10 Nathan Ellis, 11 Adam Zampa

Andrew McGlashan is a deputy editor at ESPNcricinfo
